sections.title: Syntax
sections.raw_content:
A namedType is one of:

  (a) typeId
  (b) moduleId . typeId

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: A type can be given a name (typeId) and later this name can be used instead of writing out the type.
sections.mdown_content: A type can be given a name (*typeId*) and later this name can be used instead of writing out the type.

sections.title: Example
code:
type phoneRecord :
            record
                name : string ( 20 )
                phoneNumber : int
                address : string ( 50 )
            end record
        
        var oneEntry : phoneRecord
        var phoneBook : array 1 .. 100 of phoneRecord
sections.raw_content: In this example, phoneRecord is a named type.
sections.mdown_content: In this example, *phoneRecord* is a named type.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
Form (a) is the most common kind of named type. Form (b) is used when the type name has been exported from a module.

Arrays whose bounds are not known at compile time cannot be named.
